website_summaries.verdict: Designed for military use, these emergency light sticks shine so brightly for so long that they meet NATO's supply standards.
pros: of light, and have a 4 yr. shelf life when inactive
Comes in many colors, but the bright green option is visible as far as a mile away
cons: A few customers got bad batches that didn't live up to claims

customer_reviews.title: Though these are great light sticks they are no better than the "Industrial ...
customer_reviews.text: Though these are great light sticks they are no better than the "Industrial Grade" Cyalumes which are cheaper. I bought 10 of these for $21.50 ($2.15/stick) and 20 of the others (link provided) for $19.47 ($0.97/stick). Snapped them both at the same time and was surprised that the light output was the same intensity and duration for both. Save your money and get the Cyalume SnapLight Green Glow Sticks – 6 Inch Industrial Grade, High Intensity Light Sticks with 12 Hour Duration (Pack of 20)
customer_reviews.author: Todd D.

customer_reviews.title: bright as hell
customer_reviews.text: Used em to mark my teams packs during the night portion of a SAR course this weekend and they were bright as hell. Ended up actually covering them a little bit to cut down on the light pollution and maintain our natural nightvision in the woods while searching. Also used them to mark our hasty shelter so guys weren't walking into each others shelters at night. Stick lasted probably 6 hours or so at full brightness but were identifiable from 100 meters for at least another 2+ hours. Good product
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Manufacturing Date
customer_reviews.text: Received product that was manufactured more than two years ago, leaving less than 50% of the shelf life before expiration. Returned to Amazon for refund, and placed an order directly with Cyalume. The manufacturer shipped "fresh" product that was just one month old, providing the full 4 year shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Roaster

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the same as the military issue I remember
customer_reviews.text: The 12hr green is shown next to the 8hr white one and next to a candle. The green one was twice as useful as the white one. It is exactly what I remember using when I was in the military. I would buy them again. I don't think I will buy the white ones again. Expiration date on the lot I received was 02/24. They both lasted all evening until I went to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great light. Give 4 stars not 5 based on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great light. Give 4 stars not 5 based on observation/comparison of light brightness and duration, compared to a industrial grade. Be advised the extra $4 a dozen for Military grade from industrial grade doesn't appear to mean "brighter" or "longer lasting" light, but rather the thicker plastic outer material and eye-loop at the top and possibly longer shelf-life???? I compared the regular, industrial and military grade Cyalume and found industrial to be the best value in terms of general emergency use. Recommend save $$ and go with industrial grade.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Extremely long duration of very bright light
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in an emergency road side light and this seemed to fit the bill. The light is very bright and lasts 24 hours easy. Great for camping and emergencies. The package says it discolored clothing, but I wasn't able to see any issues with my shirts when wearing it as a necklace.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeOne

customer_reviews.title: This Product Stands the Test of Time!
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing! After a whole year in the HOT secured compartment of my vehicle, they still light up and last for hours!!!! Way awesome for a product at a really cheap price! (The following pics are not made up) For real!
customer_reviews.author: Seth R Powell

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: bent one over, turned out all the lights, and you could easily navigate through the house. Tossed it outside on the porch and went to bed. It was still glowing strong nine hour later. It started to dim a bit but it still glowed 12 hour later. I would buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Waterdog

customer_reviews.title: Used these 3 times during a power outage.
customer_reviews.text: I keep these all over the house for when the power goes out. Flashlights are hard to find in the pitch black. The Green lasts 12 hours and I hang them up or leave them on the counter so I can see where I am going.
customer_reviews.author: tonnya151

customer_reviews.title: Dead in half an hour. Green ones from the ...
customer_reviews.text: Dead in half an hour. Green ones from the same seller are very bright. The blue ones are about as bright as the greens after the greens have been activated for 8 hours. Look at the picture for comparison. The green ran all ight then I put it in the freezer. The blue has been running less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Nevil_Clavain

customer_reviews.title: Safety, functional and fun
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I keep them in our car for emergencies and use them for family activities in the dark. My kids love these and we used them on the Fourth of July to enhance the fun and add safety. They are far brighter and last much longer than the typical light sticks you buy at your local sporting goods store. They give usable light for changing a tire in the dark and still have a solid glow 24 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: brian johnson

customer_reviews.title: Brighter than other sticks on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've thrown a few of these into every emergency bag, kit, box and drawer that I have. After testing this Cyalume item against others listed on Amazon, I can report that these are brighter and last longer. Buy green for better ambient lighting. Buy yellow for better visibility from long-distances.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Light up the night with chemlights
customer_reviews.text: Great product, this chemical lights work well for a variety of uses. I have used them on an early morning hike in at dark while deer hunting. It provided great illumanses to navigate through the dense brush but not enough to highlight my silhouette, making it perfect to get into position undetected. They work well for Halloween not only to mark my kids, but to use in pumpkins. I keep several on hand as well for emergency preparedness, they last throughout the night making them ideal.
customer_reviews.author: bbb625

customer_reviews.title: Cemlights are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used them so I cannot rated the brightness or longevity, but they come on time and ship described. I like having cemlights and carry them in every bag I own.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack26

customer_reviews.title: Super-reliable emergency lighting is a good idea.
customer_reviews.text: Work as described. For some buyers, it might not be worth the extra cost to get "genuine" Cyalume product. However, I paid the extra cost (double) because in my application, reliability is more important than cost. Keep a few in your car, backpack and nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light When You Need it . . Any Place, Any Timee
customer_reviews.text: Used these with the military. Was very pleased to find a source for them. They are great for all types of emergency lighting needs. Was provided excellent service for my order & will be reordering again when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy for camping with kids
customer_reviews.text: The white and yellow light sticks make great night lights if you're camping with kids. They also last all evening and overnight in the tent. Light sticks are also a lot safer than giving your kid a tactical flashlight for heading to the bath house in the dark. Be careful, though - the kids may "accidentally" give them out to all their friends! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Straight to the Point
customer_reviews.text: i loved using this for annual training at night , we didn't have any moonlight or star light, this was great it lit up for 8 to 12 hours, with intense light.
customer_reviews.author: Blanco843

customer_reviews.title: I picked them up for my nephews originally for use ...
customer_reviews.text: I picked them up for my nephews originally for use on Halloween and gave them each one to play with. I didn't pay attention to the fact that they are military grade, and they aren't joking. Incredibly bright, they last for the 12 hours stated, and they're large enough to be used in case of a power outage. Make sure you have somewhere to put them that will cover the light they give off, otherwise you'll end up lighting up the entire area and missing out on a decent nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: gonzotgreat23

customer_reviews.title: Useful emergency and outdoor illumination
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with light sticks. They seemed like a good thing to have for power outages and outside. I tried one a few evenings ago. I have the yellow. It is easy to use and bright. They don’t fill a large room but using multiple sticks will be useful during nocturnal gatherings. Mine was still glowing pretty bright after 12 hours and still had enough glow to mark a trail after 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R.

customer_reviews.title: Bright and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Used these for the first time a couple nights ago with the kids. They loved them and the quality is very high. Nice and bright, and they were still lit when the kids woke up the next day. If I had to recommend something to improve these, I would say they should include a small bit of string or something to tie them to something. I had nylon string with me, so I fashioned my own loops, but it's easy enough and useful enough that I think they should include this inside the packets.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used these yet they're in my emergency pack but based on the reviews I think they will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk-C

customer_reviews.title: Go for the 15 Min. one's
customer_reviews.text: go for the 15 Min. ones if you need a lot of light. This one produces a dull light, enough to read a grid map or throw down a hole. They well last to the 8hr mark. But it well be useable till the 26.5hr mark. Though after 6 hours it starts to dull about 5% every hour after that. At the 12~26hr mark its only good for bread crumbing an area.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Good to have for Bug-out bag, car, home emergency lighting
customer_reviews.text: Yes are bright. Placed them in our emergency BOB and have around house if we loose power. No complaints and would recommend. Will buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the premium price
customer_reviews.text: These light sticks put out a bit more light than the 'no-frills' sticks, but its hard to justify the high price. The carabiner top is handy for attaching the stick to clothing or thin cord, para cord would be a tight fit. The wrapper is tough but tears fairly easily when you need to use the stick. I used a stick at 25 degrees C (just above the rated test temp) and it activated very quickly. After about 6 hours it was significantly dimmer and after 10 hours it was virtually dead. At full brightness, I still needed to back the stick up with a foil reflector to navigate a dark house.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R Martin

customer_reviews.title: I think I got an old or bad batch. They were dim and burned out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I think I got an old or bad batch. They were dim and burned out quickly. I have used these kind of chemlights since I enlisted in 99, so plenty of experience with them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Kenner

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very bright chemlights, long lasting. Probably will buy more at a later point.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCallister

customer_reviews.title: Make shift nav light !
customer_reviews.text: Chemlights are awesome military grade . We use to use them all the time out on night ops and work great marking camp sites ... The white wont last as long as your greens and red but still bright enough to use as a rear nav light on my kayaks
customer_reviews.author: Erik olson

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Keep them in my vehicles and in the house for power outages.
customer_reviews.author: j. grant hoover

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Got these for an emergency bag. Tested one to see how long they would last and got 14 hours of usable light. Hopefully they all work that well.
customer_reviews.author: Mengles

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Sticks
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered in a timely manner. The sticks are great for power failures or blackouts. Instead of searching for flashlights you give one of these to each person and getting around in the dark is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Joyner

customer_reviews.title: A lot at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used them yet but I’m sure they are fine
customer_reviews.author: Susan Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Simply a must have
customer_reviews.text: Simply a must have. Doesn't have to be "tactical" (whatever that means), the "industrial" are just as good and a little cheaper. You just can't beat these for safe light during power outages (my only experience). We live in earthquake country and these (both 30 min and 8 hour) are a must have for our emergency bag. They are Non-flammable, Non-Toxic, do the job as promised, and are kid/pet safe.
customer_reviews.author: Slam Bones

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: When bent, these sticks emit light. Not much more to say.
customer_reviews.author: Khang Truong

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had issues with generic chemical light sticks and always ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had issues with generic chemical light sticks and always come back to these. I carry a couple in my SAR pack to mark trail intersection and give to subjects to help me see them on walks out of the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Very bad color choice for illumination
customer_reviews.text: Very bad color choice for illumination. if you intend to use it as a marker and not for any type of emergency lume, they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. i use these in my tactical kit set up and they work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Good for safety and emergency
customer_reviews.text: These are good for emergency and bug out bag. I used one just to see and it was bright for about an hour and then dimmed over the next 4 and then was a low grade light for the next 3. What do you want though... if you want a light... buy a powered light. I bought a 10 pack and this is going to suit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Del Juadalupe

customer_reviews.title: Miss the old, new ones do the job very well
customer_reviews.text: Miss the old ones, these are bright and do the job as intended, not seen anybody else do better and not charge a arm for what a chem light is
customer_reviews.author: Darian Huffman

customer_reviews.title: More like 8 hours of usable light
customer_reviews.text: Good product I would buy it again. The only thing I noticed when I tested the stick. Is it really only gave out about 8 hours of usable light. After 8 hours I had to take the stick and put it really close to what I wanted to see.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find these anywhere in town. Don't want battery operated, wanted something that works without batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Worthy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these recently and I really like them. They are bright (at least for the initial few hours) and slowly fade away. They seem strong and emit a nice white light. I once kept a started light stick outside for a whole night (it was about 45- 50 deg F) and it still was glowing in the morning, probably like after about 8 hours (the brightness reduces in colder weather).
customer_reviews.author: Jaideep

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my older grandson He really likes them going to use Them camping
customer_reviews.author: Lee Randall

customer_reviews.title: Just chem lights, No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Chem lights, a must for every home incase of emergency. These lights are no different from what is expected from chemical lighting, they are easy to store and grab at a moments notice and are safe to use in any enviroment. Do not expect flashlight quality, however, because these lights will not illuminate a room, and begin to dim dramatically after activation.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT, RIGHT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use for camping and nighttime water-skiing.I buy glow sticks several times a year and these are great quality(not the kids knock offs that barely work....these are milspec all the way) and the price was way cheaper than i can get from local stores. will definitely be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: bright, long life
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. Got them on a pre-Halloween sale. Much brighter than the discount brands, and last a lot longer (although, for Halloween night, a couple hours is all that's needed). But these were still glowing the next morning - very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnett

customer_reviews.title: good chem, wrong color
customer_reviews.text: i got the wrong color, received grow instead, still works. but not what i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Chem Lights
customer_reviews.text: I tried the white and was as pleased with them. The green seems to work better. They lasted way past 12 hours though. It was still enough at 18 hours that I could see around me. Buy the military grade if you are using for Bug-Out-Bag or fro emergencies around the house. Let the kids play with the dollar stores ones.
customer_reviews.author: TurkeyMan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chem lights.
customer_reviews.text: These last 12 hours no problem. Mine have had light for up to 18 hours. It's not super bright after 12 hours but it's bright enough that you could use it to light a compass or map in the middle of your camping trip at night. I carry it on my hit vest at work, in my camping gear, and around the house for power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these are bright
customer_reviews.text: You can read by these glowsticks at night. Seriously. You can get at least 24 hours of glow out of them, even though it's much dimmer by the second night, naturally. I'm not sure how long they stay "fresh" in the packaging, but mine lasted a year and probably would have gone farther.
customer_reviews.author: K. Raudive

customer_reviews.title: Military Grade? I don't know, but they are BRIGHT and they last LONG!
customer_reviews.text: These things really are high quality, work exceedingly well. Lasted nearly two days while camping! Bright enough to light up a 10 foot area pretty much at their peak brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Yep, Green chem light. It does last for 12 hours
customer_reviews.author: Fastloop

customer_reviews.title: Great light soure in storms.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got them my wife thought I was crazy. Now she feels different. She loves them when she goes into thee attic or down in the basement. They work great when the power is knocked out during the storms. Tks for a great product.G.Goff.....
customer_reviews.author: raygoff67

customer_reviews.title: I'm old and have need these devices in my car ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm old and have need these devices in my car many times for emergencies. Trust a well-traveled old lady, you need these kept in your trunk. Just put 2 or 3 in there because they wont stand excess heat for long and Texas heat will ruin anything.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Princess

customer_reviews.title: The ones you want...
customer_reviews.text: Sticks of light. Simple you'd think, but there's a bunch out there with varying output, endurance and size. These are the real deal though, with an 8 hour life and a super bright light. You might not be marking cleared rooms during urban warfare ops, but if you want the same gear for your pop up tent that special forces use to pop the bad guys, these are them. Buy a pack. Own the night. Roast those marshmallows.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J. Hoare

customer_reviews.title: Great glow sticks long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Great glow sticks last a long time and are bright enough
customer_reviews.author: ally

customer_reviews.title: Decent priced chemlight
customer_reviews.text: They crack, they glow, they're green! Not much to say. Well packaged and come in a large box that you could sell them out of retail or at some night time event to a bunch of kids.
customer_reviews.author: PositiveRateTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: They are what they say. Good product. Good value!
customer_reviews.text: They are brighter than the ones at dollar store.They will last 8hrs or longer.
customer_reviews.author: Svansice

customer_reviews.title: For the price and the wait, not worth it ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the wait, not worth it. Compared to Walmart's $1.38 glow sticks, they are the same brightness, and last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Bright and long lasting. 20 hours later was still bright enough for a location marker.
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Albritton

customer_reviews.title: "Shine bright like a diamond"
customer_reviews.text: These ChemLights get the job done! If you plan to use them for Emergencies, Military, Camping or just want to have a straight up neon dance show; these are a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for part of my emergency grab and go packs. Upon testiing one, it lasted through the night and kept a nice glowing light that I was able to see with easily. I have them tucked away in numerous packs, in my cars and in my RV. Glad to have them!
customer_reviews.author: synergy58

customer_reviews.title: Should say 15 + hours.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and lasted 16 hours with the first test.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Good units that are properly stamped with an expiration date
customer_reviews.text: Good units that are properly stamped with an expiration date. Most of these units only have about a 1-2 year shelf life. These units have a longer shelf life, and are marked to let you know when you should replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Cyalume Light
customer_reviews.text: Sent with daughter going to Costa Rica - wonderful - easy transaction - showed up in great shape and assembled easily for an amazing price. Would recommend to anyone in the market for this type item.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaWyo

customer_reviews.title: light is bright
customer_reviews.text: Light is bright. I used them for a night dive and they worked, its eerie how they dim a bit with closer water temp the deeper you go (because the chemical reaction is effected by ambient temperature)
customer_reviews.author: Victor Markuski

customer_reviews.title: Brightest of all my glow sticks
customer_reviews.text: These ate the Brightest of all my glow sticks. They are fast delivery and very good priced. I would highly recommend these products for anybody who wants a bug out bag or doomsday prepper
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Not that bright.
customer_reviews.text: Normally I buy these in Green. The Yellow are not as bright and do not last as long. Buy the Green ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hackenberg

customer_reviews.title: Let there be light
customer_reviews.text: If you are having a party somewhere in a Southern California high density homes' rat maze, set out a trail of Cyalume sticks so folks can find you.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Al

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Gives off a nice bright light that last a good time.. I use these for camping, hiking and Kayaking at night. Gives off a nice bright life without losing your night vision..
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Better than green or yellow
customer_reviews.text: If you really want good light say to perform a task by white is the way to go. Yes it's harder for your eyes to adjust to over the green but they put out way more light
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Carry them in my go bag. You never know when you will need them.
customer_reviews.author: David McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Up to par on military standards
customer_reviews.text: As most of you know, this brand of chemlight glowsticks is expensive. But it's well worth the money! Use these in the military and I won't use any other brand. They're exceptionally bright and emit light for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Very brought and long lasting!!!
customer_reviews.text: These glow sticks are the brightest I have ever seen, granted I haven't seen a lot of high dollar glow sticks. I would recommend to anyone! Can't wait to buy a few more packs! These would work great if my car broke down at night and I needed a way to alert oncoming traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Powanian

customer_reviews.title: Milspec Chemlights
customer_reviews.text: works as described..light continues to work for up to 18 hours at lesser degree of intensity. The industrial grade is a better value as you could use 2 lights and get 24 hours of light for the price of 1 of these military grade lights
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good chem lights
customer_reviews.text: Good chem lights. They work until they don't. I don't have time to time them. They provide light. Buy them if you want. Stop looking. :)
customer_reviews.author: db1

customer_reviews.title: Never know when you need light
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright 8 hours of light I like blue because I can see blood. Easy to brake but not fragile keep 4 on my tac vest one on my carbine and two on my person never know great portable light.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great little Chemlight
customer_reviews.text: Good little chem light, I use it to put on my dogs collar at night when camping you can see her from a mile away
customer_reviews.author: CJ Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Better than normal ones
customer_reviews.text: MUCH better than the ordinary cyalume lights. These are brighter and last longer than the normal ones. They were very bright for 4+ hours, and wee still glowing after 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Povey

customer_reviews.title: Brightest I've seen
customer_reviews.text: These are the brightest chem-lights I've seen, and good price. I would say the duration is closer to 8-10 hours than 12, but still great value. Far, far better than the $1 "glow sticks" sold in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I would buy it from the seller again. The lights exceeded my expectations. It worked great when it was warm but when the weather was little chill, the brightness was not what I was expecting. Overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ki

customer_reviews.title: We used these years ago in the army and these ...
customer_reviews.text: We used these years ago in the army and these are the same quality. No problems and no issues. I intend to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: I loved them! I got them very quickly with Prime ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved them! I got them very quickly with Prime and was not disappointed at all! Came in a nice box with the full set of 10 I think. Each individually packaged and can't wait to use them when I go camping or backpacking!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wise

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: The light works as it says it will. My only problem was I don't care for the white light. I prefer the green. So there is nothing wrong with the product, it was just a preference. They were shipped very quickly
customer_reviews.author: TurkeyMan

customer_reviews.title: More than 8 hours
customer_reviews.text: They say 8 hours - but it continues to perform sometimes for as many as 12.
customer_reviews.author: ross paul martin

customer_reviews.title: Good quick light
customer_reviews.text: We used this to keep a very dark johnny on the spot lighted, so our guests were not afraid to go inside it at night. The light stayed on all night and everyone was relieved!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Works better than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. They last longer than advertised. I like the fact that they come sealed in packages of one.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Parks

customer_reviews.title: Kykid
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use them when camping in my truck. Snap one on at dusk and you have enough light to see all night without attracting insects. They have convienent clip on end for attaching to just about anything.
customer_reviews.author: KYkid

customer_reviews.title: Light where you need it
customer_reviews.text: When camping some times you just need to find the tent zipper without waking the others you are camping with this dose that all night long also marks your campsite for and easy return from the latrine
customer_reviews.author: Toxikviper

customer_reviews.title: These Are Great In Case Of Power Outage
customer_reviews.text: My husband is in the military and he told me to look for the military grade am glad i found them and hope i only have to use them in a natural power outage and nohing more !!
customer_reviews.author: Bentleybabee

customer_reviews.title: Great, incredibly bright light sticks
customer_reviews.text: Great, incredibly bright light sticks. Used them on a house boating trip in Kentucky for some night fishing, and was not disappointed. Well packaged. I would certainly buy these again for a midnight fishing excursion.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Trusewicz

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your Bug Out Bag
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for your disaster/emergency kit. I have several in my Bug Out Bag. In rainy conditions it would be a much better light source than a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: The Travel Blogger

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: These last at almost full strength for about 8 hours, with complete loss of light after about 20. Defintaley worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Andromeda

customer_reviews.title: Great chem lights
customer_reviews.text: These chem lights are bright and last as long if not longer than advertised. Great for when the lights go out, broke down on side of road or natural disaster
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I can't say that I would recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that I would recommend this product to anyone. They are very dim & don't put out much light at all.
customer_reviews.author: George Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: hope they are good as putting them aside for when needed.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS G. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what is available in stores
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. The first two we used this last weekend for Halloween stayed lit for over 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality light
customer_reviews.text: Great light, last a long time with plenty of light given off.
customer_reviews.author: isaac brandt

customer_reviews.title: Got only 2 month expire!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this 02/19 All 10 sticks printed on EXPIRE 04/19 !!!!! Are you kidding me?
customer_reviews.author: Klueze

customer_reviews.title: light stick
customer_reviews.text: These shipped and were packaged just as advertised. They seem to be of good quality and hopefully they will last the advertised 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

product_meta.title: Cyalume ChemLight Military Grade Chemical Light Sticks – 12 Hour Duration Light Sticks Provide Intense Light, Ideal as Emergency or Safety Lights, for Tactical Applications, Hiking or Camping and Much More, Standard Issue for U.S. Military Personnel – Green, 6” Long (Pack of 10)
product_meta.description: Color:Green"The Cyalume ChemLight chemical light stick is the gold standard in chemical light technology. When electric light isn’t an option, rely on ChemLights. These light sticks provide intense light output for up to 12 hours, and the bright green color can even be seen from up to a mile away. Standard issue for U.S. military personnel around the globe, these tactical-grade light sticks aren’t some child’s toy you find at a party store. You can rest easy knowing there’s no better alternative available. Whether you’re using these chemical light sticks for tactical applications, as part of your emergency kit, for hiking, camping or even just for your children to play with, you can be sure they will provide just the right amount of light necessary. Plus, they’re water-proof, non-flammable and have a non-toxic chemistry, so they’re just as safe as they are durable. You can let your children use them when hiking or playing in the backyard, but they’re also ideal for a confined space, underwater and tactical applications. The chemical light stick has a hook and gate top which keeps the light source secure whether you’re hanging, attaching or stringing them together. ChemLights are made in the USA under strict quality guidelines to ensure each light stick works without issue when you need it the most. Competitors “adhere to military guidelines” – ChemLight is the gold standard. These light sticks also come with a guaranteed 4-year shelf life and individual foil wrapping. They’ll be safely stored and ready to go when you are! To activate ChemLight, simply bend, snap and shake to immediately flood your surrounding area with functional light. Each green light stick measures 6” long, 10 sticks per pack. ChemLight light sticks meets Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) and NATO Maintenance and Supply Agency (NAMSA) specifications. National/NATO Stock Numbers (NSN) are printed on each product for reference. For technical specifications, see the Material Safety Data Sheet below. The maker of ChemLight, Cyalume, is a pioneer and world leader in chemical lighting solutions for tactical and safety applications. Trusted by the US Military and government agencies for over 40 years, you can rest assured knowing that our products will perform when they are needed most – without question. All Cyalume products are expertly engineered and crafted in the USA to strict quality standards. "
feature_bullets: INTENSE LIGHT OUTPUT FOR UP TO 12 HOURS means you can get the job done when electric light isn’t an option. The patented, long-lasting formulations in our ChemLight chemical light sticks provide up to 12 hours of 360 degree illumination. The bright green color can be seen from up to a mile away.
OFFICIAL CHEMICAL LIGHT OF THE U.S. MILITARY – ChemLight military grade light sticks are standard issue for all military personnel, so you know there’s no better alternative available.

VARIETY OF USES – Whether you’re using these chemical light sticks for tactical applications, as part of your emergency kit, for hiking, camping or even just for your children to play with , you can be sure they will provide just the right amount of light necessary.

WATER-PROOF, NON-FLAMMABLE, NON-TOXIC CHEMISTRY means ChemLight light sticks are as safe as they are durable – you can even let your children use them when hiking or playing in the backyard. Also ideal for confined space, underwater and tactical applications.

MADE IN THE USA UNDER STRICT QUALITY GUIDELINES to ensure each light stick works without issue. Competitors “adhere to military guidelines” – ChemLight is the gold standard. These chemical light sticks also come with a guaranteed 4-year shelf life and individual foil wrapping. They’ll be safely stored and ready to go when you are!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
